title: Lavash
summary: Lavash is a thin flatbread[1] usually leavened, traditionally baked in a tandoor (tonir) or on a sajj, and common to the cuisines of South Caucasus, Western Asia, and the areas surrounding the Caspian Sea.[2][3][4] Lavash is one of the most widespread types of bread in Armenia, Azerbaijan, Iran and Turkey.[5] The traditional recipe can be adapted to the modern kitchen by using a griddle or wok instead of the tonir.[6]
